title: U.S. Will Train More Ukrainian Troops, Adding Advanced Battle Tactics
description: Western instruction since Russia’s invasion has focused on basic training or the use of sophisticated weapons systems. Officials say “combined arms” tactics could be a key next step.

title: Your Friday Briefing: The U.S. Will Train More Ukraine Troops
description: Plus: Chinese companies are hit by U.S. trade restrictions.

title: A Russian Missile, a Sudden Death, and Unspeakable Grief
description: In the immediate aftermath of an attack, the horrors of the Ukraine war, the random death and the lives upended take on a deeper meaning when seen close-up.

title: U.S. to Expand Training for Ukrainian Forces
description: The Pentagon aims to instruct one Ukrainian battalion each month in advanced battlefield tactics, beginning early next year, U.S. officials said.

title: Harry Takes Aim at William in New Episodes of Netflix Documentary
description: The younger prince made several incendiary allegations about his brother, who is now heir to the British throne.

title: The US Imposes Sanctions on a Russian Oligarch and Other Officials
description: The sanctions block financial transactions in dollars with Vladimir Potanin, the largest shareholder in Nornickel, the world’s biggest producer of palladium and refined nickel.

title: UN Peacekeeper Killed in Southern Lebanon
description: An Irish peacekeeper deployed along the Lebanese border with Israel was shot and killed, and three others were injured. The attack is being investigated.

title: Boris Becker Returns to Germany After Release From British Prison
description: The tennis champion left for his home country after serving time in Britain for hiding his assets in a bankruptcy case.

title: Nurses in UK Strike for First Time, Seeking Higher Pay
description: The walkout is just one of a series of industrial actions across Britain this month as ballooning inflation, rising interest rates and a recession put pressure on workers.

title: How to Hand Out Billions in Climate Subsidies? Very Carefully.
description: John Podesta, the White House aide overseeing new tax credits, said rules were expected to be in place within months. Avoiding waste and fraud is a priority.

title: A Look Inside New York’s Swirling Kaleidoscope of Faiths
description: The city is home to some of the most spiritually and culturally diverse areas in the world. Here are some of them.

title: US Cracks Down on Chinese Companies for Security Concerns
description: The Biden administration placed severe restrictions on trade with dozens of Chinese entities, its latest step in a campaign to curtail access to technology with military applications.

title: In Qatar, the Ancient Sport of Falconry Gets Some Upgrades
description: The training regimen now involves drones, but doomed pigeons are still in the mix. Generations of Qataris have taken up the hobby.

title: Russia Says It Would ‘Undoubtedly’ Target US Patriot Missile Defense System
description: Moscow said that Washington’s plans to supply Kyiv with its most advanced air defense system raised the risk of drawing the U.S. directly into the war.

title: Covid May Spread From Corpses, Scientists Report
description: Family members and health care workers should take precautions, experts said.

title: From Behind Bars, Inmates Award France’s Latest Book Prize
description: For the first time, detainees picked their own winner in an offshoot of the Goncourt, France’s top literary honor.

title: Gun Violence and Children
description: A portrait of an American tragedy.

title: Traumatized by Covid, but Ruled by a Party That Never Apologizes
description: Gripped with grief, anxiety and depression, many in China want a national reckoning over the hard-line “zero Covid” policy. Holding the government to account may be a quixotic quest.

title: What We Learned From ‘Harry and Meghan,’ Part Two
description: The second collection of episodes of the couple’s Netflix docuseries landed on Thursday. It dives deep into mental health and royal drama.

title: In the World of Wrestling, a Heavy Hitter Steps Into the Ring
description: The owner of the Los Angeles Lakers believes WOW — Women of Wrestling can be an engine of female empowerment. Her performers, known as “superheroes,” are breaking new ground in the historically male-centric space.

title: An Alternate Reality: How Russia’s State TV Spins the Ukraine War
description: Leaked emails detail how Russia’s biggest state broadcaster, working with the nation’s security services, mined right-wing American news and Chinese media to craft a narrative that Moscow was winning.

title: An Alternate Reality: How Russia’s State TV Spins the Ukraine War
description: Leaked emails detail how Russia’s biggest state broadcaster, working with the nation’s security services, mined right-wing American news and Chinese media to craft a narrative that Moscow was winning.

title: The Infrared Hunt for Russian Troops in the Battle for Bakhmut
description: On a frigid December night, The New York Times accompanied members of a surveillance team for the Ukrainian Army as they used a thermal sight to find enemy positions miles away.

title: Day 15: Finding Christmas Joy in ‘The Nutcracker’
description: For a mother and daughter, the sweetest moment came when the production broke a barrier with the first Black dancer to play Marie, the brave young heroine.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Russian trench warfare in Ukraine.
